name: elfvexd
params: class c0, class c1, class c2, wff w0

stmt.origin: syl(w0, wcel(c0, universe), wcel(c1, cfv(c2, c0)))

body.origin:
|- wi(w0, wcel(c0, universe))
-| wi(w0, wcel(c1, cfv(c2, c0)))
-| wi(wcel(c1, cfv(c2, c0)), wcel(c0, universe))

cumulated.origin:
|- wi(w0, wcel(c0, universe))
-| wi(w0, wcel(c1, cfv(c2, c0)))
-| wi(wcel(c1, cfv(c2, c0)), wcel(c0, universe))

|- wi(w0, wcel(c0, universe))
-| wi(w0, wcel(c1, cfv(c2, c0)))

comment: If a function value has a member, then its argument is a set. Deduction form of ~ elfvex . (An artifact of our function value definition.) (Contributed by David Moews, 1-May-2017.)
